Job Title: Creative Design Director

Location: Brooklyn, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
As the Creative Director, you will be the driving force behind our creative space, overseeing people, processes, and the output of our creative team. Your leadership will ensure that what we create not only meets but exceeds the standards of quality and innovation our brand is known for. This role demands a keen eye for detail and design, exceptional team management skills, and a strategic approach to balancing speed, quality, and cost.
Responsibilities
Leadership and Vision: Own the creative space, setting and maintaining high standards for the team and the results. You will have ultimate decision making responsibility for the creative output across our ecommerce sales division.Creative Vision: Determine the creative vision and direction of critical projects. Set guidelines for creative standards and give final approval for mission critical projects, as aligned with company needsTalent Sourcing: Build and implement processes for finding, onboarding, training, and offboarding that your creative team leads can use for managing their team members.Team Building: Lead the internal build out of our in-house creative division and build a roster of external creative resources, building a team that maintains high standards of quality and efficiency, while balancing the budget and aligning with company objectives.Process Optimization: Develop and own the processes used by the creative division and ensure their effectiveness and usefulness as the team evolves and grows.Budget Management: Set and manage project budgets, SLAs, and KPIs. Ensure that the team is effectively allocating resources across projects.Collaboration: Serve as the main point of contact for collaboration between department heads, owning the escalation process and ensuring clear communication across departments. Set processes on how design team members communicate with product managers for effective and clear communicationOperational Excellence: Ensure clear visibility into team capacity, SLAs, and backlogs to facilitate effective project management and prioritization.Priority Setting: Set the priority of projects and set standards for what projects will be accepted by the team and the necessary resources to allocate to the project.

Experience Level (if available): None
